$eref.description: The Topic Properties definition.

___enableExpress.description: Value that indicates whether Express Entities are enabled. An express topic holds a message in memory temporarily before writing it to persistent storage.

___filteringMessagesBeforePublishing.description: Whether messages should be filtered before publishing.

___enableBatchedOperations.description: Value that indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.

___status.description: Enumerates the possible values for the status of a messaging entity.

___requiresDuplicateDetection.description: Value indicating if this topic requires duplicate detection.

___isAnonymousAccessible.description: Value that indicates whether the message is accessible anonymously.

___duplicateDetectionHistoryTimeWindow.description: TimeSpan structure that defines the duration of the duplicate detection history. The default value is 10 minutes.

___autoDeleteOnIdle.description: TimeSpan idle interval after which the topic is automatically deleted. The minimum duration is 5 minutes.

___maxSizeInMegabytes.description: Maximum size of the topic in megabytes, which is the size of the memory allocated for the topic.

___entityAvailabilityStatus.description: Entity availability status for the topic.

___enablePartitioning.description: Value that indicates whether the topic to be partitioned across multiple message brokers is enabled.

___defaultMessageTimeToLive.description: Default message time to live value. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus. This is the default value used when TimeToLive is not set on a message itself.

___supportOrdering.description: Value that indicates whether the topic supports ordering.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.
Microsoft.ServiceBus/namespaces/topics/authorizationRules
Microsoft.ServiceBus/namespaces/topics/subscriptions
The Queue Properties definition.

___deadLetteringOnMessageExpiration.description: A value that indicates whether this queue has dead letter support when a message expires.

___enableExpress.description: A value that indicates whether Express Entities are enabled. An express queue holds a message in memory temporarily before writing it to persistent storage.

___enableBatchedOperations.description: A value that indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.

___status.description: Enumerates the possible values for the status of a messaging entity.

___requiresDuplicateDetection.description: A value indicating if this queue requires duplicate detection.

___isAnonymousAccessible.description: A value that indicates whether the message is accessible anonymously.

___duplicateDetectionHistoryTimeWindow.description: TimeSpan structure that defines the duration of the duplicate detection history. The default value is 10 minutes.

___autoDeleteOnIdle.description: the TimeSpan idle interval after which the queue is automatically deleted. The minimum duration is 5 minutes.

___lockDuration.description: The duration of a peek-lock; that is, the amount of time that the message is locked for other receivers. The maximum value for LockDuration is 5 minutes; the default value is 1 minute.

___maxSizeInMegabytes.description: The maximum size of the queue in megabytes, which is the size of memory allocated for the queue.

___entityAvailabilityStatus.description: Entity availability status for the queue.

___enablePartitioning.description: A value that indicates whether the queue is to be partitioned across multiple message brokers.

___requiresSession.description: A value that indicates whether the queue supports the concept of sessions.

___defaultMessageTimeToLive.description: The default message time to live value. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus. This is the default value used when TimeToLive is not set on a message itself.

___supportOrdering.description: A value that indicates whether the queue supports ordering.

___maxDeliveryCount.description: The maximum delivery count. A message is automatically deadlettered after this number of deliveries.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

Description of Subscription Resource.

___deadLetteringOnMessageExpiration.description: Value that indicates whether a subscription has dead letter support when a message expires.

___isReadOnly.description: Value that indicates whether the entity description is read-only.

___requiresSession.description: Value indicating if a subscription supports the concept of sessions.

___enableBatchedOperations.description: Value that indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.

___status.description: Enumerates the possible values for the status of a messaging entity.

___defaultMessageTimeToLive.description: Default message time to live value. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus. This is the default value used when TimeToLive is not set on a message itself.

___autoDeleteOnIdle.description: TimeSpan idle interval after which the topic is automatically deleted. The minimum duration is 5 minutes.

___lockDuration.description: The lock duration time span for the subscription.

___entityAvailabilityStatus.description: Entity availability status for the topic.

___deadLetteringOnFilterEvaluationExcept.description: Value that indicates whether a subscription has dead letter support on filter evaluation exceptions.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.
Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.
Properties of the namespace.

___createACSNamespace.description: Indicates whether to create an ACS namespace.

___enabled.description: Specifies whether this instance is enabled.

SKU of the namespace.

___capacity.description: The specified messaging units for the tier.

___tier.description: The billing tier of this particular SKU.
